summary: Kenneth D. Klein was an employee of the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents available primarily relate to his payroll records and employment details within the HSCA. These records include information about salary adjustments and termination details. The documents suggest that Klein's role was significant enough to warrant maintaining detailed payroll records, but the specific nature of his work within the HSCA is not detailed in these documents.
significance: Kenneth D. Klein's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with investigating the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. While the exact nature of his role is not specified in these documents, his payroll records are part of the broader collection of HSCA documents preserved for historical review.
